doc:
Christine Earle https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christine_Earle 0 Christine Earle is an Australian actress, best known for her role as Janet Williams in the television series Prisoner. She appeared in a guest roles in Neighbours both before and after Prisoner. Earle Began acting with Crosswinds Theatre in Community after completing an Economics Politics Degree at La Trobe University and Monash University. She joined the Magic Mushroom Mime Troope after two years with Crosswinds. She later Joined Anthill Theatre and performed in a Lead role in Hamletmachine as Ophelia. She joined the European Experimental Theatre with Jon Pierre Mignon. Earle Produced and performed Gurdjieff movements at St Martins Theatre Melbourne. She was a resident at the Samyeling Tibetan Buddhist Monastery in Scotland for 4 years. She spent one year in Northern India studying meditation (Vedanta). She Performed at La Mama, The Universal and also had roles in Australian TV series like SeaChange and Stingers. Earle_Began acting with Crosswinds_Theatre in Community after completing an_Economics_Politics_Degree at La_Trobe_University and Monash_University . She joined the_Magic_Mushroom_Mime_Troope after two_years with Crosswinds . She later Joined Anthill_Theatre and performed in a_Lead_role in Hamletmachine as Ophelia . She joined the_European_Experimental_Theatre with Jon_Pierre_Mignon . Earle_Produced and performed Gurdjieff_movements at St_Martins_Theatre_Melbourne . She was a_resident at the_Samyeling_Tibetan_Buddhist_Monastery in Scotland for 4_years . She spent one_year in Northern_India_studying_meditation_(_Vedanta_) . She Performed at La_Mama , The_Universal and also had roles in Australian_TV_series like SeaChange_and_Stingers .
